newsitem.title: SWEDEN: VOLVO DECLINES COMMENT ON PRIPPS REPORT.
newsitem.headline: VOLVO DECLINES COMMENT ON PRIPPS REPORT.

text.p: Swedish automotive group Volvo on Monday declined to comment on Swedish media reports that it planned to sell its 55 percent stake in brewer Pripps Ringnes to a foreign brewery group.
Business daily Dagens Industri said on Saturday that Dutch Heineken and Belgian Interbrew were potential buyers of the majority stake.

"Pripps Ringnes's strong market position in Sweden and Norway and its successful expansion in the Baltic region and further east makes the company an attractive option for Continental brewery groups," Dagens Industri said.
Volvo spokesman Per Lojdquist said he had no comment to make on the report.

Norwegian food group Orkla , which owns the remaining 45 percent of Pripps Ringnes, has an option to acquire Volvo's holding, but the paper said Orkla is not believed to have the financial muscle to complete a buy-out.
